weather_report:
Morning in Mascot opens with a diluted, silvery light and a sky that seems to be thinking about rain. Sunshine will be fleeting, the day tending toward a grey, soft-focus clarity with light showers likely drifting in from mid to late afternoon and lingering toward evening. Even so, it’s December; the UV can still bite when the cloud thins around midday, so a hat and sunscreen are sensible companions. The air feels on the mild side of warm, a touch humid rather than crisp, more gentle than bracing.

Dress in breathable layers and shoes that won’t complain about damp footpaths; tuck a compact umbrella or light rain shell in your bag. It’s a good day for a late-morning errand run or a quiet loop through the neighborhood before the sprinkles arrive, then something unhurried under a roof: a browse at the library, a tidy of the workspace, or a simple lunch somewhere with a window where you can watch the showers come and go. If you’re commuting later, give the streets a few extra minutes; they’ll be slick and reflective, holding the day’s pale light.
